concise_definition: v. 施压, 逼迫, 催促

definitions.explanation_en: To exert persistent influence or force on someone to make them do something, often against their will or better judgment, typically through emotional, social, or psychological means.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过持续的情感、社会或心理手段对某人施加影响或压力，迫使其做某事，通常违背其意愿或理性判断。
definitions.example_en: She felt pressured by her parents to major in medicine, even though she wanted to study art.
definitions.example_cn: 尽管她想学艺术，却仍感到父母逼迫她选择医学专业。

definitions.explanation_en: To create a situation in which someone is compelled to act quickly or make a decision under time constraints or external demands.
definitions.explanation_cn: 制造一种情境，使某人因时间紧迫或外部要求而被迫迅速行动或做出决定。
definitions.example_en: The manager was pressuring the team to finish the report by Friday.
definitions.example_cn: 经理正催促团队在周五前完成报告。

definitions.explanation_en: To apply sustained social or institutional pressure to influence behavior, policy, or outcomes, often in a public or political context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在公共或政治语境中，通过持续的社会或制度性压力来影响行为、政策或结果。
definitions.example_en: Activists are pressuring the government to pass stricter environmental regulations.
definitions.example_cn: 活动人士正在施压政府通过更严格的环保法规。

comparison.analysis: “Coercing” (胁迫) 指使用威胁、暴力或法律强制力迫使他人服从，具有更强的非法性或暴力性。而 “pressuring” 通常不涉及直接威胁，更多依赖心理或社会压力，如内疚、从众或期望。
“Urging” (敦促) 是一种温和、积极的劝说，强调鼓励和支持，通常带有善意或建设性目的。而 “pressuring” 带有强迫性，常引发抵触或不适感，语气更强势甚至令人窒息。
“Compelling” (迫使) 指因逻辑、证据或强大理由而使人不得不接受或行动，强调合理性与必然性。而 “pressuring” 更侧重于外部施加的非理性压力，可能缺乏正当性，甚至带有操纵性质。
